46455.query: I have a document that needs to be checked for profanity. Can you remove any profane words from the text and replace them with asterisks? Also, please let me know if the document contains any profanity.

available_tools.name: remove_profanity_for_purgomalum
available_tools.description: This is the subfunction for tool "purgomalum", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "Calling the web service involves a simple HTTP GET request. The only two requirements for using PurgoMalum are the "text" parameter on the query string and the request-type name as part of the path in the request"

add.description: A comma separated list of words to be added to the profanity list. Accepts letters, numbers, underscores (_) and commas (,). Accepts up to 10 words (or 200 maximum characters in length). The PurgoMalum filter is case-insensitive, so the case of you entry i

fill_text.description: Text used to replace any words matching the profanity list. Accepts letters, numbers, underscores (_) tildes (~), exclamation points (!), dashes/hyphens (-), equal signs (=), pipes (|), single quotes ('), double quotes ("), asterisks (*), open and closed c

fill_char.description: Single character used to replace any words matching the profanity list. Fills designated character to length of word replaced. Accepts underscore (_) tilde (~), dash/hyphen (-), equal sign (=), pipe (|) and asterisk (*). When not used, the default is an as

available_tools.name: check_if_text_contains_profanity_for_purgomalum
available_tools.description: This is the subfunction for tool "purgomalum", you can use this tool.

29653.query: As a web designer, I need a tool that can generate thumbnails for my clients' websites. Can you suggest an API that can create thumbnails in various sizes, like small, medium, and large? It would be helpful if the images are ready for download as soon as they are generated.

available_tools.name: get_2_thumbnail_ready_for_pagepeeker
available_tools.description: This is the subfunction for tool "pagepeeker", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "Poll this API until it returns that the image is available.  If available, you can download through endpoint 1.  Rendering an image depends largely on how fast a particular web page is loaded (and if it contains Flash).  Average waiting time is around 20 -"

size.description: t = Tiny, 90 x 68 pixels;  s= Small, 120 x 90 pixels;  m = Medium, 200 x 150 pixels; l = Large, 400 x 300 pixels;  x = Extra large, 480 x 360 pixels

url.description: The URL to generate the thumbnail from

available_tools.name: get_1_shoot_thumbnail_for_pagepeeker
available_tools.description: This is the subfunction for tool "pagepeeker", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "Issues a reset API call if refresh is set to 1. Else it will download if the image is ready (see endpoint 2.)"

size.description: t = Tiny, 90 x 68 pixels;  s= Small, 120 x 90 pixels;  m = Medium, 200 x 150 pixels; l = Large, 400 x 300 pixels;  x = Extra large, 480 x 360 pixels

url.description: The URL to generate the thumbnail from

refresh.description: This parameter forces the currently generate d thumbnail to be regenerated.  It is optional and will be ignored unless it contains the value 1
